events.description: Colombo, Sri Lanka Ongoing through Tuesday, December 2, 2025 Sri Lanka is set to transform gaming in South Asia, a market of 2 billion people, projected to surpass $7.5 billion by 2028 and boasting a 20% annual growth rate. By the financial year 2023, India’s gaming market had surged to an impressive 3.1 billion U.S. dollars, marking it as one of the fastest-growing segments. Coupled with the projected growth in the mobile games segment – India is expected to lead with 239.63 million users by 2027. Pakistan also continues to navigate an increased appetite for gambling, with the industry expected to grow at a CAGR of 6.4% during 2020-2026, and reach USD 0.51 billion by 2026. Increased internet penetration, a young population, rising income, and the fast adoption of mobile payment systems all point to new growth to come from this upcoming market. As of 2023, Pakistan boasted 257 game development companies and 300 gaming studios – a PwC report indicates the country´s game market could see an expansion of 21.9%. More info: sigma.world…

Player Protection Summit 2025 seeks to rejuvenate this vital discussion, equipping industry stakeholders with the latest methods and ethical marketing practices that prioritise player well-being.  More info: www.eventus-international.com…

events.eventName: National Council of Legislators from Gaming States (NCLGS)
events.description: San Juan, Puerto Rico Wednesday, December 10 – Saturday, December 13, 2025  The NCLGS semiannual meetings attract dozens of state legislators as well as regulators, gaming operators and suppliers, attorneys, lobbyists, media, and other stakeholders to discuss all aspects of regulated gaming. The meetings help state legislators from across the country establish sound, effective gaming policies.NCLGS, founded more than a quarter-century ago, is the only organization of state lawmakers that meets on a regular basis to discuss issues related to gaming. NCLGS neither promotes nor opposes gaming but is focused on proper regulation and promoting best practices in the governance of this important industry.NCLGS attendance continues to grow; the recent summer meeting in Pittsburgh continued the trend of record attendance with more than 300 attendees. NCLGS now consistently draws more than 100 legislators and regulators.Contact Details Sherry Amos609-703-1947samos@spectrumgaming.com More info: www.nclgs.org

Attendance surged by 200%, cementing our position as Brazil’s premier industry event.Now, the eyes of the entire industry are on 2026.SBC Summit Rio is a strategic imperative for anyone serious about succeeding in Brazil. events.description: Hilton Garden Inn Vilnius City Centre Tuesday, April 21, 2026 HIPTHER Baltics: Vilnius is the first stop in our new Baltic-focused event series, designed to provide deep local insights with regional relevance. As Lithuania continues to shape itself as a digital-first economy, this conference will explore the dynamic relationship between iGaming regulation and fintech innovation in one of Europe’s most forward-thinking markets.This one-day summit brings together key stakeholders from across the gaming, payments, tech, legal, and regulatory landscapes to address both opportunities and challenges emerging at the intersection of these two fast-evolving sectors.What to ExpectHigh-level panel discussions featuring regulators, industry leaders, and innovatorsExpert-led workshops and practical sessions via HIPTHER AcademyTargeted networking opportunities with key decision-makersA boutique-style conference experience in a premium central Vilnius locationKey Themes and TopicsRegulatory updates and market outlook for iGaming in Lithuania and the BalticsFintech integration in gaming: payment systems, digital wallets, and embedded financeAML, compliance, and licensing best practices in multi-jurisdictional environmentsThe role of AI and automation in regulatory processesPublic-private collaboration for sustainable growthStrategic insights for operators, affiliates, and fintech innovatorsWho Should AttendiGaming operators and service providersFintech companies and payment solution providersLegal and compliance professionalsRegulators and government officialsAffiliates, startups, and investors active in the Baltic region  More info: hipther.com…

Latvia stands at the crossroads of dynamic regulatory development and increased attention to responsible gaming—making Riga the ideal location to explore how cross-border operations intersect with rising expectations for player safety, data integrity, and regulatory clarity.With the 2026 theme set as “Cross-Border Compliance & Player Protection,” this one-day conference brings together a curated mix of regulators, operators, legal experts, compliance leaders, and responsible gaming advocates to unpack the evolving frameworks shaping the Baltic and European iGaming markets.Key Themes and Topics///Cross-border licensing and compliance challenges in the Baltic & CEE regionPlayer protection frameworks and responsible gaming initiativesData privacy, risk management, and fraud preventionAML directives and regulatory harmonization across jurisdictionsSelf-exclusion systems and national registers: effectiveness and implementationReal-world case studies from regulators and operatorsConsumer protection in the context of digital transformationWhat to Expect///Targeted panels and legal deep-dives featuring regional and EU-wide perspectivesWorkshops led by compliance professionals and policy advisorsHIPTHER Academy sessions focused on practical skills and strategic planningNetworking opportunities with key decision-makers and regulatory stakeholdersA boutique event format designed for high-quality engagement and collaborationWho Should Attend///Compliance officers and legal professionals in gaming and fintechRegulatory authorities and government agenciesiGaming operators, affiliates, and platform providersRisk, fraud, and AML specialistsResponsible gaming and player advocacy groupsTech startups addressing gaming compliance and integrity More info: hipther.com…
